Articles.Content:
Hey there...

I got back to KSP after a really long pause just now and I'am happy to see that nearly all of my mods are still running and have been updated. Had a blast so far but is there currently any mod that allows to grow food in orbit for TAC-LS? Last time I played there was a mod that allowed for Soylent/Algae production in Orbit via "Solar Panels" but that mod isn't working anymore and I lack the skills to make it work in career and/or the current version.

Is there any mod that works right now and is somehow identical to that?

 

Edited May 18, 2020 by keksmonster0991

Right off the top of my head, there is Nils' Planetary Bases Systems that has TACLS support and greenhouses (intended for surface use, obviously, but no reason why they shouldn't work in space as well).

There are definitely others that I just don't remember right now; Nertea's collection might be worth looking into for example.

Edited May 18, 2020 by Corax
INVISION
Soylent still works, as far as I know...  (Ignore the title of the mod thread.  There's an update for KSP 1.9.)

Thanks for the quick replies. I gave Soylent a try but somehow only the new dark parts showed up for me. Guess it's a mod conflict but going through them is gonna be a chore to find the culprit.  

Looks like my Kerbals need to learn how to grow and farm.

@keksmonster0991 I have a mod that provides Mk2 and Mk3 greenhouses and woks for TAC. It's one of my earliest mods so the grass (if any) is a pretty amateur paint job on the hull of a borrowed stock part, but it gets the job done. I don't use the soylent scheme, only TAC's nutrient supplement thing.
